channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ROO-2095] roobot.xml pool of downloads
item.description:
Startup script on Cygwin still unresolved. I get a constant pool of below at the roo.sh or roo command.

Downloaded 0% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 0% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 0% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 0% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 0% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 0% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 44% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 73% of roobot.xml.zipD[FelixDispatchQueue] Id property must be named "id" (found "_id") for org.opevel.dao.ListingsRole - required for GWT support
roo> Downloaded 73% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 73% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 73% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 73% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 92% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zip

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please test with the latest Roo code from Git.

We have a similar issue with OS X, where its Terminal is unable to perform ANSI cursor movement operations. Both roo and roo-dev startup scripts detect OS X Terminal and disable the advanced ANSI support. See the scripts for an example. It might be necessary to do something similar for Cygwin, although it would be preferable that Cygwin users can enjoy a better terminal experience (so only disable it if testing shows it really is a problem with later Cygwin versions on later Windows versions; Windows Server 2003 as noted above in the environment seems quite old to me).
I just loaded 1.1.1.RELEASE in cygwin, and I can't reproduce the issue

Alan, I found Roo URL pointing to git clone git://git.springsource.org/roo/roo.git. But I can't seem to be able to clone it. I get this:

fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly00 KiB 1 KiB/s
fatal: early EOF
fatal: index-pack failed

Does the repository have anon access? (I don't think so). I also tried to configure git to use the user Kanga Roo as described at https://jira.springsource.org/browse/ROO-817, Obviously that requires a password.

So how do I clone the roo.git repo?
It just worked for me, would you please try again?
Closing now for impending 1.1.2 release. Please re-open if you think there still is a problem

Getting the same error as the thread starter: "100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zip"

Running Windows7 64bits, Java6 64bits, Roo 1.1.2.RELEASE

This is still a problem in Roo 1.1.4.RELEASE.

I am on Windows 7, Java 6 (1.6.0_24-b07), 32 bits.

My cygwin is CYGWIN_NT-6.1.

The ANSI flash message just dumps below the command line and then hangs, rather than updating in the upper right corner.

FYI - Getting the same messages as the thread starter: "100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zipDownloaded 100% of roobot.xml.zip"

Running Windows7 64bits, Java6 32bits, Roo 1.1.5.RELEASE (STS 2.7.1) - Win 'CMD' Box

The Roo shell still works and the STS version appears un affescted

Changing to an improvement. This issue does not appear to be something we can change in Roo to get it to work, as earlier versions of Cygwin do not show the issue. Moreover, Cygwin is not something we want to support going forward. A workaround is to use the Windows version of Roo, or Linux or OS X.
Closing as valid work around is to use Windows or Linux.
